location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.317 of 1852 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Kemball requests from Malet instructions for the disposal of one hundred crowns, which was originally to be paid to Sheikh Sultan ben Suggar [Sultan bin Saqr] of Ra's al-Khaymah, as part of a larger sum of 600 crowns, to be used as indemnity on the part of actions against shipwrecked Indians by one of the sheikh's subjects.
